Title: Hyperbole
References: ŠTULAJTEROVÁ, A., JESENSKÁ, P.: English Stylistics. 1. vyd. Banská Bystrica : Univerzita Mateja Bela, 2013. 114 s.
Content:
A hyperbole (hyper - over) is a figure of speech which involves exaggeration of ideas for the sake of emphasis.

It intensifies one certain property of the given object. It is a deliberate overstatement of a feature essential to the object or phenomenon. It is a device that we deploy in our day-to-day life.

examples:

  • Ages have passed when I last saw you! 
  • I had to wait for eternity. Then she finally came.
